result.execSummary:
The defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
Concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 197 DAYS time served.

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery of a Financial Institution

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Reconsideration
Received and filed: Proposed Decision and Order Denying Motion for Reconsideration
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for reconsideration. (Ladarius McGhee #618229, Dodge Correctional institution, PO Box 700, Waupun, WI  53963).

Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for sentening hearing.  Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 9 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 197 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $0.00.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

FILED: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Final Pretrial. 
  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

 

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned  for Sentencing.
Plea Questionnaire & Addendum
Wisconsin Criminal Jury Instructions 1622 & 580
State's Motion In Limine - received
State's Requested Jury Instructions - received
State's Witness List - received
Demand For Speedy Trial - received  (expires August 30, 2022)
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Ladarius D McGhee not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant may no longer want to enter a plea.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 28.
State advises Court that cases are not joined.  Court will schedule both cases for trial on the same date.  In the event one case cannot proceed to trial the parties should be prepared to proceed to trial on the other case.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Defendant's Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Ladarius D. McGhee - #2022000537, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Ladarius D McGhee not in court, in custody.  
Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Parties are still negotiating but believe this matter will resolve.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF3552. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Lackovic. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28. Case remains calendared for 3/3/2022 at 1:30pm for scheduling.  Hearing will be held on Dacast:

Court ordered no contact with North Shore Bank; Nazirah M.T.; Aisha E.Y.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ladarius Deequanmay Mcghee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Motion to dismiss by defense for errors in offense date in charging sections of Counts 1 and 2 argued and DENIED by the Court.  State moves to orally amend complaint, correcting errors.  Court GRANTS oral amendment and corrects dates in charging section to read Tuesday, December 21, 2021 as verified by the State.  State to file an amended complaint.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
